title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 July 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
01:07 <Mariah> has joined #xwiki  
01:12 <Mariah> has quit  
01:39 <kstuart> has quit  
02:42 <Denis> has quit  
02:52 <sdumitriu> has quit  
02:53 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:00 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
07:01 <npm> has quit  
08:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
10:39 <sdumitriu> Pong  
10:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: in git, when I see a commit message that has the following:  
10:40 <vmassol> git-svn-id: https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/xwiki-products/xwiki-enterprise/trunk@4057 f329d543-caf0-0310-9063-dda96c69346f  
10:40 <vmassol> what does it mean?  
10:40 <vmassol> that it was imported from svn?  
10:40 <sdumitriu> Yes  
10:40 <vmassol> and the author is whom?  
10:40 <vmassol> I see you for ex as author  
10:40 <sdumitriu> Revision 4057  
10:40 <vmassol> is the person who did the import?  
10:40 <sdumitriu> Usually the author is the same as the git author  
10:40 <vmassol> \*it  
10:41 <sdumitriu> git author == svn committer  
10:41 <vmassol> ok  
10:41 <vmassol> I'm doing stats  
10:41 <vmassol> so I don't need to exclude those  
10:41 <vmassol> they're valid  
10:45 <vmassol> indeed, I've just checked with svnsearch and it looks good  
11:14 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki

17:43 <vmassol> has quit  
18:38 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
19:37 <Denis> has quit  
19:45 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
21:09 <kstuart> has quit  
21:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:39 <sdumitriu> has quit  
21:41 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
22:25 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
22:28 <chalx> has quit  
22:32 <vmassol> has quit  
23:14 <junix659> has joined #xwiki  
23:15 <junix659> is xwiki free?  i'm guessing no...  
23:16 <sdumitriu> junix659: WDYM?  
23:16 <junix659> the web page looks like its a paid product...  
23:16 <sdumitriu> Which one?  
23:16 <junix659> xwiki enterprise  
23:16 <sdumitriu> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/License  
23:16 <sdumitriu> Which xwiki enterprise page?  
23:16 <junix659> i went to .com  
23:17 <junix659> ok, just wanted to make sure  
23:17 <junix659> not sure if anyone else has been exposed to other wikis' (free and paid products) but how does this standup to Confluence?  
23:17 <junix659> or MediaWiki?  
23:19 <sdumitriu> Which car is better, a large Jeep, a fast sports car, a family-sized minivan, an ecomonic compact?  
23:19 <sdumitriu> Tell me your usecase  
23:19 <sdumitriu> These are very different types of wikis  
23:19 <junix659> i don't have a usecase at the moment  
23:19 <junix659> i'm just looking around and playing with stuff  
23:20 <junix659> i just got done setting up mediawiki and docuwiki  
23:20 <sdumitriu> MediaWiki is good for a simple documentation wiki  
23:20 <junix659> but they don't look very clean...  
23:20 <junix659> i use confluence at my work  
23:20 <junix659> and its nice  
23:20 <junix659> clean  
23:20 <junix659> interface  
23:20 <sdumitriu> Confluence is good for a mare professional wiki with enterprise features  
23:20 <junix659> it's ok  
23:20 <junix659> search functionality sucks  
23:21 <junix659> that's my biggest complaint  
23:21 <sdumitriu> XWiki is better than Confluence since it has better extensibility, you can easily write your own applications to add new features  
23:21 <junix659> ok  
23:21 <junix659> i won't be writing and extensions  
23:21 <sdumitriu> Some find Confluence more polished  
23:21 <sdumitriu> But XWiki is a lot like Confluence in terms of functionality  
23:21 <sdumitriu> Others find XWiki easier to use  
23:22 <junix659> ok, i couldn't find an open source equiv to confluence either  
23:22 <sdumitriu> Depends from person to person  
23:22 <junix659> cool  
23:22 <junix659> xwiki uses mysql back end?  
23:22 <sdumitriu> It works on MySQL, but it works on almost any relational database  
23:23 <junix659> nice!  
23:23 <sdumitriu> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DatabaseSupportStrategy  
23:23 <junix659> cool  
23:24 <junix659> ok cool  
23:24 <junix659> if i install it on a system w/ mediawiki and docuwiki, think i'll have problems?  
23:24 <junix659> how resource intensive is it?  
23:25 <sdumitriu> Quite a lot  
23:25 <junix659> boo  
23:25 <junix659> my systems aren't that great...  
23:25 <sdumitriu> It requires around 512M of RAM to work properly  
23:25 <sdumitriu> More would be good  
23:25 <junix659> ok, no worries  
23:26 <junix659> i'd give it 1GB  
23:26 <junix659> right now i've got some stuff runnning in OPenVZ  
23:26 <junix659> my machines aren't fast enough or new enough
